expanded_text: Residents and business owners who pay for utilities. These are the owners of UEC, as it is a branch of publicly-owned utilities.
UEC is located in the Mahany Park Complex, which includes the Martha Riley Library, Sports Center, and Mahany Park. UEC is located within the library building.
UEC is a branch of publicly-owned utilities: Roseville Electric Utility and Roseville Environmental Utilities.
UEC seeks to have a positive relationship with city offices. Additionally, it would like to build up relationships with environmental agencies at local, state regional levels.
UEC works with the news media to promote programs and events.
UEC wants to build stronger partnerships with local businesses. Partnerhsips could take the shape of event co-hosts, event vendors, sponsors, or Chamber of Commerce

Students coming on field trips with their tk-6 teachers are an important audience. Chaperones on these field trips also build commenctions to UEC and can experience outcomes in learning and attitude change as a result of their experience.

UEC staff consists of 4 full time staff (museum and interpretive professionals). They are supported by several part-time staff and a volunteer core. Volunteers can either work regularly (min 8 hrs/mo) or work just for special event.

School groups, tk-6 grade, are an important audience for UEC. Exhibits and programs must meet their needs, inclucing content alignment with California State Science Standards. Currently, school groups are maxing out UEC's capacity.
Gardeners are a regular, core audience for UEC.
Multi-generational families are the main target audience for UEC. Roseville is a family community, with above average rates for home ownership, income, and education.

text: Reflect on the interconnectedness between utility, customer, community, and planet
expanded_text:
I am part of many systems.
I am part of the natural world.
I play a role.

“I had no idea how much these systems are all connected to me, and that my utilities are doing so much for me and the future of my community.”
“I should do the right thing because it benefits me, but also because it benefits my community when we all work together.”

text: Amaze with what our utilities do every day.
expanded_text:
My utilities do some complex things.
Trust.

“I’m amazed by and grateful for what great things can be done by great people, both in my community and in my utilities.”

This is what I can do.
saving $, saving environment
worry, about condition of environment, community, bottom line
pride, community
home

“I can act today and make a difference.”

text: UEC is a recognized leader for utility education and interpretation.
Utilities see UEC as essential to meeting their goals for reduction of waste/consumption
Businesses and institutions see UEC as a mutually beneficial partnership.
Rate payers see UEC as a worthwhile investment.

text: UEC's reputation as a place worth connecting to

expanded_text: Community groups whose main target audience is families is a sub-audience for UEC -- they connect UEC with a more diverse and focused set of the family audience.
UEC's adult programs appeal most to people who already have something of an interest in environmental stewardship.
